item.title: Case studies of design in OSS
item.description: This page is a collection of resources, links, articles, case studies and more that are relevant examples of how design can be done in OSS or case studies by designers in Open Source Software. These links can serve as inspiration for your own research or to further your understanding of how design manifests in open communities. Document Foundation UX Principles: All designs for LibreOffice should be checked against these principles.

item.title: Reading list
item.description: Various readings and learnings about design and user experience, usually with some kind of Open Source overlap or context. Trauma & design PubPub: Some basic definitions key to understanding the relationship between trauma and design. Maintained by: KJ Hepworth Kat Lo Eriol Fox Shirin Mori Ushahidi Open Design, maintained by Eriol Fox: A collection of resources, notes, and other written content for distributed, asynchronous design contributions to software projects.

item.title: Tools for OSS Designers
item.description: Various tools that are preferably and primarily OSS for designers to use in developing Open Source Software. Penpot.app: Collaborative UI design prototyping and design system creation tool (alternative to Figma and Adobe XD) Interactive content or app. Able to be self-hosted. Excalidraw: A great intuitive and attractive tool for easy imaging/chartm-aking.
